text: a recent study found that between 50 to
60% of people are finding work via
direct referrals and other internal
moves things like moving a resume onto
the top of a pile or giving a personal
direct referral that means that more
than half of people are using their
network as a means to further their
careers now this doesn't mean that the
number of friends that we have on
facebook directly contributes to how
successful we are because this network
only really includes individuals who
like you enough to want to help you out
as well as put their name on the line
just for you but if we were to sit down
and count the number of people who fit
these requirements in our lives we might
find that we don't know as many people
as we think we do in fact the average
American reports only having about nine
people that they would consider
themselves to be close with 39 percent
of people report only having three to
five and fourteen percent of people
report only having one to two so how is
it that the skills needed to develop
something that determines the careers of
sixty percent of people is barely ever
covered in school things that can
improve your network mainly social
skills including conversation skills
body language skills leadership skills
public speaking skills and sales skills
are not being or barely ever covered at
all in schools it's silly to think how
some people can spend 15 years of their
life dedicated to educating themselves
yet they never really learn the skill
set that has the highest chance of
ensuring their future a lot of it comes
down to the way our educational system
thinks they think ah these kids they'll
figure it out themselves but the truth
is the large majority of people have a
huge room for improvement in terms of
their social skills personally even I
had issues when it came to building
connections when I was at
younger but luckily for us we live in
the Golden Age of information videos
books courses and studies are all within
a moment's reach the one thing that
schools forgot to teach us is how to
build up our connections so take this
opportunity as a reminder to work on
ourselves because it is vital to our
success in the future
